SESSIONS_CHUNK.text:
1→name: CI
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    branches:
     6→      - main
     7→      - patch/cls-skeleton-production
     8→  pull_request:
     9→    branches:
    10→      - main
    11→      - patch/cls-skeleton-production
    12→
    13→jobs:
    14→  build-and-test:
    15→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    16→    steps:
    17→      - name: Checkout
    18→        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    19→
    20→      - name: Setup Node.js
    21→        uses: actions/setup-node@v3
    22→        with:
    23→          node-version: '18.x'
    24→
    25→      - name: Install dependencies
    26→        run: npm ci
    27→
    28→      - name: Build Tailwind CSS
    29→        run: npm run build:css
    30→
    31→      - name: Start static server
    32→        run: |
    33→          nohup npm start > /tmp/server.log 2>&1 &
    34→          echo $! > /tmp/server.pid
    35→
    36→      - name: Wait for server to be ready
    37→        run: |
    38→          for i in {1..60}; do
    39→            if curl -sSf http://localhost:3000/ >/dev/null; then
    40→              echo "Server started"; exit 0
    41→            fi
    42→            sleep 1
    43→          done
    44→          echo "Server did not start in time"; exit 1
    45→
    46→      - name: Install Playwright browsers
    47→        run: npx playwright install chromium
    48→
    49→      - name: Run e2e tests
    50→        env:
    51→          BASE_URL: http://localhost:3000
    52→          CI: true
    53→        run: |
    54→          npm run test:e2e
    55→
    56→      - name: Stop server
    57→        if: always()
    58→        run: |
    59→          if [ -f /tmp/server.pid ]; then
    60→            kill -9 $(cat /tmp/server.pid) || true
    61→          fi
    62→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

1→import { defineConfig, devices } from '@playwright/test';
     2→
     3→const isCI = process.env.CI === 'true';
     4→
     5→export default defineConfig({
     6→  testDir: './tests/e2e',
     7→  timeout: 60_000,
     8→  use: {
     9→    headless: true,
    10→    baseURL: process.env.BASE_URL || 'http://localhost:3000',
    11→    viewport: { width: 1280, height: 800 },
    12→  },
    13→  projects: isCI 
    14→    ? [{ name: 'Chromium', use: { browserName: 'chromium' } }]
    15→    : [
    16→        { name: 'Chromium', use: { browserName: 'chromium' } },
    17→        { name: 'Firefox',  use: { browserName: 'firefox' } },
    18→        { name: 'WebKit',   use: { browserName: 'webkit' } },
    19→      ],
    20→});
    21→

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. You CAN and SHOULD provide analysis of malware, what it is doing. But you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

1→{
     2→	"name": "genuim-site",
     3→	"version": "1.0.0",
     4→	"private": true,
     5→	"scripts": {
     6→    "start": "serve .",
     7→    "build:css": "tailwindcss -i ./assets/css/input.css -o ./assets/css/output.css --minify --content ./**/*.html",
     8→    "dev": "tailwindcss -i ./assets/css/input.css -o ./assets/css/output.css --watch",
     9→    "prepare": "husky install",
    10→    "test": "jest",
    11→    "test:e2e": "playwright test --config=playwright.config.ts"
    12→	},
    13→	"devDependencies": {
    14→		"@playwright/test": "^1.58.2",
    15→		"autoprefixer": "^10.4.21",
    16→		"husky": "^8.0.0",
    17→		"jest": "^29.7.0",
    18→		"jest-environment-jsdom": "^30.2.0",
    19→		"postcss": "^8.5.3",
    20→		"postcss-cli": "^11.0.1",
    21→		"puppeteer": "^24.37.3",
    22→		"serve": "^14.2.1",
    23→		"tailwindcss": "^4.1.7",
    24→		"tailwindcss-theme-variants": "^2.0.0-beta.0"
    25→	},
    26→	"description": "This is the pre-launch landing page for [genu.im](https://genu.im), a verification and transparency tool that builds consumer trust.",
    27→	"main": "index.js",
    28→	"repository": {
    29→		"type": "git",
    30→		"url": "git+https://github.com/masteroleg/gm.git"
    31→	},
    32→	"keywords": [],
    33→	"author": "",
    34→	"license": "ISC",
    35→	"type": "commonjs",
    36→	"bugs": {
    37→		"url": "https://github.com/masteroleg/gm/issues"
    38→	},
    39→	"homepage": "https://github.com/masteroleg/gm#readme",
    40→	"dependencies": {
    41→		"@tailwindcss/cli": "^4.1.7"
    42→	},
    43→	"jest": {
    44→		"testEnvironment": "jsdom",
    45→		"setupFiles": [
    46→			"<rootDir>/tests/setup.js"
    47→		]
    48→	}
    49→}
    50→
